summary: Uber is now offering Waymo autonomous rideshare services in a second market, adding Atlanta in June . The company is positioning itself as a long-term winner, offering a massive customer list to partners who spend billions necessary to perfect self-driving technology .  In June, Uber began offering self-driving rides in Atlanta using Alphabet's Waymo service . Uber is the only way to book Waymo rides across a 65-square-mile stretch of the city . This is the second market where the two companies have partnered .  The Motley Fool Stock Advisoranalyst team identified what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy now . Uber Technologies wasn’t one of them . The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years .  Suzanne Frey, an executive at Alphabet, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors . She and Lou Whiteman both own Uber Technologies .

Each week our analysts hand pick their favourite Narratives from the community (what is a Narrative?). This week’s picks cover: WhySuncorp’�sinsurance-only pivot gives it room to grow revenues . WhyThyssenkrupp Nuceracan leverage its unique position for green hydrogen adoption . WhyTeslais reaching an AI and robotics inflection point .  It turns the mainstream Tesla bear narrative on its head with a sharp, well-reasoned case for re-rating it as an AI and robotics platform . The parallels to Nvidia’s transformation are compelling, and the author backs it up with product-level traction, forward catalysts .  These narratives are general in nature and explore scenarios and estimates created by the authors . The fair value estimate’s are estimations only, and do not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock . Author Michael Paige and Simply Wall St have no position in any of the companies mentioned .  We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data . Our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material .

According to most demand projections, electric vehicle (EV) stockshave a bright future . Tesla's capital advantage is undeniable . There's one opportunity in particular that could create significant value . It's not easy to start an electric car manufacturing business .  Tesla has an enviable capital advantage because it can raise new capital at any time . Lucid and Rivian remain unprofitable, but Tesla has been profitable nearly every quarter for the past five years . Tesla can raise $25 billion in fresh cash by diluting existing shareholders by just 2.5% .  Elon Musk recently launched a robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, powered by semi-autonomous Tesla vehicles . Eventually, Tesla intends to produce Cybercabs: EV designed specifically for autonomous taxi services . Cathie Wood, CEO of Ark Invest, thinks 90% of Tesla's market cap will eventually be attributed to its robotxi division .  The robotaxi opportunity alone could add $1 trillion to Tesla's market cap by the end of 2026 . That suggests more than 100% in near-term upside, with plenty of runway in the years to come .  Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late for investors . Nvidia, Apple, Netflix and Netflix are all receiving "Double Down" alerts . There may not be another chance like this anytime soon .  Tesla stock could set you up for lifewewas originally published by The Motley Fool . Tesla is one of the fastest-growing companies in the world .

Tesla TSLA has been a polarizing stock over the last decade, delivering massive gains for investors . In 2025, shares have been volatile, down 25% overall with big price swings . Tesla reported Q1 revenue of $19.3 billion and adjusted EPS of $0.27 in its latest release .  Tesla delivered roughly 337k EVs and produced nearly 363k throughout the period . Sales climbed 67% year-over-year to $2.7 billion . The company’s gross margin contracted to 16.3% vs. a 17.4% print in the same period last year .  Rivian has 100% US vehicle manufacturing and sources most materials (excluding cells) in the US . The company revised its current-year guidance concerning vehicle deliveries as a result, now expecting FY25 deliveries in a range of 40-60k . The earnings outlook for Rivian remains bullish, with the current Zacks Consensus EPS estimate of -$2.49 up 14% .  Rivian RIVN shares have been much stronger in 2025, with the company’s EPS outlook much more favorable . Tesla's current Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) rating, investors would be better off waiting on positive EPS revisions .

Tesla stock fell Tuesday in conjunction with multiple bearish catalysts . Elon Musk's feud with Trump was a factor in the sell-off, but concerns about vehicle shipments could have been a bigger factor . Tesla has plenty of long-term growth opportunities, but its near-term outlook seems challenging .  Tesla stock is now down 13% over the last month and roughly 26% across 2025's trading . The U.S. Senate passed President Trump's tax and budget bill without a provision that would have limited the ability of states to craft their own artificial intelligence (AI) regulations .  Nvidia, Apple, Netflix and Netflix are all about to pop . Nvidia is one of the most successful companies in the U.S. market . Netflix and Nvidia are among the top three companies you can invest in . Ether (ETH) price fell to $2,418.39 on July 1 after a day of steady losses . The downturn follows a high-profile dispute between Elon Musk and Donald Trump over the former president’s tax-and-spending plan .  SharpLink Gaming (Nasdaq: SBET) acquired an additional 9,468 ETH — worth $22.8 million — between June 23 and June 27 . This brings its total ETH holdings to 198,167, reinforcing its position as the world’s largest publicly traded holder of ETH .  BitMine has disclosed a $250 million private placement to fund an ETH treasury strategy . The deal, expected to close by July 3, includes major backers such as Pantera, Founders Fund, Galaxy Digital, Kraken, and DCG . ETH declined 3.3% over the past 24 hours, falling from $2,500.88 to $2.418.39 .  ETH briefly dipped to $2,404.47 amid the session’s highest volume of 379,855. steepest decline occurred during the 14:00 UTC hour . Bearish trend structure remains intact, with lower highs and lower lows and no clear volume-based reversal indicators .

Stanford millionaire has a blunt response to 'national bankruptcy' Balaji Srinivasan has commented on the escalating feud between President Donald Trump and Tesla CEO Elon Musk . He claims there is "real debt" in excess of $175 trillion .  Srinivasan has a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering and an MS in Chemical Engineering . After teaching at Stanford, he co-founded Earn.com, which Coinbase acquired and made him CTO . Musk shared that Bitcoin could potentially "take over" as a hedge against weakening dollar .  Vice President JD Vance cast the decisive tie-breaking vote in the Senate to pass the One Big Beautiful Bill . At press time, Bitcoin was hovering around $106,000, asper Kraken, slightly down amid fiscal anxiety .

Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 jump to fresh record levels on Wednesday after President Dona Dona . Nasdaq composite and S.P 500 both jumped to record highs on Wednesday .

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq closed up on Wednesday, lifted by gains in tech stocks . News of a trade agreement between the U.S. and Vietnam eased concerns about an extended trade war . Investors will look ahead to the non-farm payrolls report on Thursday for clues on how soon the Federal Reserve could lower borrowing costs .  The S&P 500 gained 29.28 points, or 0.47%, to end at 6,227.29 points . The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 8.70 points to 44,486.24 . The U.S. andVietnam struck a trade agreement that sets 20% tariffs on many of the Southeast Asian country's exports .  The focus is on the more comprehensive non-farm payrolls report on Thursday, a day earlier than usual . The reading is expected to show U.S. job growth cooled in June and the unemployment rate ticked up to 4.3% . Centenetumbled after the health insurer said it had withdrawn its 2025 earnings forecast .  U.S. President Barack Obama has signed a U.N. trade deal with the world's largest nations . The deal is part of a larger effort to reach an agreement on a new trade deal . Obama has pledged to sign a deal to end a long-term agreement with the EU .

Tesla delivered 384,122 vehicles in the quarter through June, down 13% from 443,956 deliveries a year ago . The drop in deliveries is a result of increased competition, plateauing demand for electric vehicles and brand damage .  The price of a used Tesla Model S and Model Y each dropped by about 16% in February from a year earlier . Rivian reported lower than expected production numbers on Wednesday, signaling trouble throughout the industry .  Several celebrities have ditched their Teslas as part of a public stand against the company . The brand damage spread outside the U.S. to Europe, where monthly sales in 32 countries fell nearly 50% in April . Last month, the company began selectively testing self-driving Model Y vehicles in Austin, Texas .  Tesla’s robotaxis will roam city streets, and humanoid robots dubbed Optimus will perform everyday tasks . The company is currently valued at $989 billion . Tesla shares have fallen more than 16% this year .

The S&P 500 rose 0.5% Wednesday and set an all-time high for the third time in four days . The Dow Jones Industrial Average edged down by less than 0.1%, and the Nasdaq composite gained 0.9% . Tesla rallied following its latest update on deliveries, while Nike and other companies that import a lot from Vietnam rose after President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with the country .  The Dow is up 1,940.20 points, 4.6%, the Nasdaq is up 5.6% . The Russell 2000 is up 53.85 points, or 2.5% .

The S&P 500 hit another record, as recovery in U.S. equities continues . Tech giants like NvidiaandTeslahad strong sessions aftersinking the day before . The DowJones had a choppy day, sinking in the morning, shooting up 0.5% .  President Donald Trump announced in a social-media post that trade deal with Vietnam would allow the companies to sell their products into Vietnam at zero tariffs . GapInc, Lululemon, and Nike all shot up immediately once the deal became public .  Investors will still be wondering whether private-sector job losses may be an initial sign of weakness in the labor market . The next BLS report will influence the Fed’s rate decisions at its upcoming July meeting .  Participants excited that the Fed may assume an increasingly dovish posture in order to defend the labor market . “It appears to be just the opposite,” says senior economist José Torres .

Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLP) rose late Wednesday afternoon with consumer stocks . Consumer Staples was the top performer in the sector . Consumer stocks rose late on Wednesday afternoon .

EV maker reported 384,122 deliveries in the second quarter, down 13.5 percent from the year-ago period . Shares rallied after the disclosure, which was better than some leading forecasts in recent days . Sales figures reflect the more contested nature of the EV market, which Tesla once dominated .  Analysts project a drop of 16 percent to $1.2 billion in profits, according to S&P Capital IQ . Tesla has faced questions about a lack of new retail auto products to wow consumers . Analysts will be looking for an update on the state of new offerings after Musk's Cybertruck proved polarizing .  Morningstar, CFRA and Wedbush say results are "better-than-feared" Wedbush's Dan Ives says Tesla is on a path to an accelerated growth path . The JPMorgan note was especially bearish, setting a December price target of $115 .  Musk donated more than $270 million to Trump's presidential campaign . Musk has broken with Trump over the White House's flagship tax and spending bill . Trump has threatened to target Musk's business empire and warned of deporting him .  Tesla shares rose 4.7 percent early Wednesday morning . Tesla CEO Elon Musk's "fears of broader policy shifts targeting Musk's business empire"

Tesla stock is climbing today thanks to macroeconomic catalysts and the market's reaction to the company's recent deliveries report . The company's share price was up 4.6% as of 2 p.m. ET amid the backdrop of a 0.3% gain for theS&P 500 and 0.7% for the Nasdaq Composite . The stock had been up as much as 5.4% earlier in the session .  Tesla delivered 384,000 vehicles in this year's second quarter -- a 14% year-over-year decline . The company's share price is down roughly 22% across 2025 . Despite some rallies connected to the company's robotaxi business and opportunities in artificial intelligence and robotics, Tesla still ranks as the worst-performing stock .  Tesla still has the potential to be a winner for investors with a very long time horizon . Tesla should be able to score meaningful wins in the robotaxi business, but these wins will take time to materialize . The company is also still trading at approximately 111 times next year's expected earnings . TD Cowen maintained its $330 price target and Buy rating on Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) ahead of the electric vehicle manufacturer’s second-quarter delivery report . From its initial prediction of 400,000 vehicles, the firm lowered its Q2 delivery projection to 362,000 . The adjustment reflected lower delivery expectations in China and the US .  TSLA is a clean energy company best known for its electric vehicles (EVs) Tesla also offers solar panels, solar shingles, and energy storage devices . The company stands to benefit significantly from Trump-era tariffs and the onshoring trend .

Meta Platforms (META) is the best-performing constituent of the group, all of whose members are artificial intelligence (AI) plays in their own right . Earlier this year, I noted that Meta looks like the best AI play among the group . In this article, we’ll analyze whether the Mark Zuckerberg-led company still earns that title .  Meta raised its 2025 capex guidance to between $64 billion and $72 billion . Last month, Meta acquired a 49% stake in Scale AI, hiring its founder, Alexandr Wang, along with other key employees in the process .  Zuckerberg said that Meta is “uniquely positioned to deliver superintelligence to the world” and highlighted the progress in wearables and AI glasses . Meta is making incremental progress in AI and is adding more AI features to its WhatsApp business suite . The company has hired several AI executives from Google, OpenAI, and Anthropic .  Meta now trades very close to its mean target price of $722.96, even as it still has a consensus rating of “Strong Buy” from the 54 analysts actively covering the stock . Zuckerberg: AI will lead to better user engagement and “improved advertising”  Meta has seen a re-rating as markets give a thumbs up to its AI strategy . The multiples will taper down as AI initiatives start adding to Meta's profit pool . The next big story for the company could be AI glasses, and while these haven't flown off the shelf yet, many believe that glasses could be the next prominent computing platform after smartphones .

US benchmark equity indexes were mostly higher intraday after President Donald Trump announced a tra tra tra a tra . President Trump also announced a plan to lower taxes on the nation's energy imports .

Billionaire investor Peter Thielsays Elon Musk's plan for "a billion humanoid robots in the U.S. in 10 years" collides with his alarm over ballooning federal deficits . Musk has repeatedly championed mass automation . He backed forecasts of one billion robots worldwide by the 2040s .  Peter Thiel warns unchecked deficits could "bankrupt the country" before robotics eases the fiscal load . Thiel's critique lands amid his criticism about technological stagnation and end-times politics, signaling a split on the tech right over whether exponential growth alone can erase red ink .  The Congressional Budget Office pegs Trump's bill as a $2.4 trillion deficit add-on, largely via tax cuts favoring higher earners . Musk insists only "radical productivity gains" will bridge that gap .

Tesla announced it produced 410,244 vehicles and deployed 9.6 GWh of energy storage products in Q2 2025 . Despite reporting a 14% decline in deliveries, the stock saw a 6.35% rise last quarter . Business expansions in India and ongoing executive changes may have contributed positively to investor sentiment .  Tesla demonstrates the ability of its ongoing expansions in India and executive changes to buoy investor sentiment . Key to this upbeat outlook is the potential for its initiatives to significantly drive future revenue and earnings . Over the past five years, Tesla shares have experienced a substantial total return of 224.54%.  Tesla's share price is slightly below the consensus price target of US$289.44 . This suggests that analysts perceive Tesla as relatively fairly priced, reflecting modestly optimistic market expectations .  Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned . Companies discussed in this article include NasdaqGS:TSLA and Nasdaq GS: TSLA .

The analysts identified over two dozen stocks in a note to clients Tuesday for exposure to an expanding AV market they believe could be worth $1.2 trillion by 2040 .  Google parent Alphabet's Waymo, Amazon's Zoox, and Tesla are some of the companies with robotaxis in the U.S. The analysts added that AV opportunities could extend to makers of agricultural equipment like Caterpillar, Deere & Co. AST SpaceMobile (NASDAQ:ASTS) was by far the mostdiscussed in a recent thread onr/stocks . The thread quickly filled with comments, and among the noise, a few well-supported picks stood out . One user noted, “They’re currently partnered with 52 [mobile network operators] worldwide that service 3.3B”  At $0.25 per user per month, that’s $9.9 billion in annual revenue . With 161 million shares outstanding, the investor claimed, “At a conservative P/E of 20, you’re looking at a $737 share price.” Still, not everyone is buying the hype .  Rocket Lab (NASDAQ:RKLB) was mentioned as a future leader in space launches . Supporters argued the company had overcome early skepticism and is now seeing upward momentum . The conversation also included smaller, lesser-known companies like Aurora Innovation .  Reddit users pitch Reddit itself as a potential investment in Reddit itself . Redditors also pitch IBM (NYSE:IBM) and rare earth miners (RDDT) MP Materials and MP Materials are seen as essential to the future of artificial intelligence, defense and electric vehicles .  Palantir, Tesla, And Nvidia are among the top three companies in the U.S. market . The company is one of the fastest-growing in the world and could be a big winner .

Tesla reported a 13% decline in vehicle deliveries for its second quarter . The drop of almost 60,000 vehicles is Tesla’s biggest quarterly decline in its history . Tesla reported384,122 total vehicle deliveries, down from443,956 last year .  Tesla’s sales in European and Asian markets have plunged throughout the year, in part due to other EV manufacturers taking the lead as demand for EV vehicles remains steady . The Austin-based company's stock is up by 4.4% at the time of publishing, but it is on course for an annual drop .  After Musk stepped down as head of DOGE, the former adviser and President Trumpentered into a feud over the proposed “Big Beautiful Bill” The budget bill, which Musk called a “disgusting abomination,” plans to cut EV tax credits, which would likely hurt Tesla’s sales . Since then, tensions between Musk and the president have risen .  The company is expected to release its second quarter financial results on July 23 after market close . Current market capitalization is upward of $1 trillion .

US equity indexes traded mixed, while the dollar hovered around its lowest in more than three years . US equity markets traded mixed as the dollar traded at its lowest level in three years in three months .

Tesla (TSLA) shares are pushing to the upside on Wednesday after data from the China Passenger Car Association confirmed the automaker’s sales of China-made electric vehicles increase 0.8% on a year-over-year basis in June . Despite the increase, Tesla stock is down 13% versus its high set in the final week of May . While China data sure is positive for investors, it's not very likely to help Tesla shares extend gains further .  Tesla delivered just 384,122 vehicles in its fiscal Q2, down significantly from 443,956 deliveries in the same quarter last year . Tesla must launch a lower-cost ($25,000) model to compete more aggressively with rivals . Tesla also needs regulatory approval for its robotaxi in multiple cities to catch up with Waymo . Tesla has to rebrand itself – which means less politics, more products, and lower prices .  The consensus rating on TSLA shares currently sits at “Hold” only with the mean target of about $297 indicating potential downside of some 5% from here . Wall Street firms are no longer bullish on Tesla stock either .

Tesla delivered 384,122 vehicles in the second quarter, a 13.5% drop from the same period last year . The market's positive reaction suggests a sense of relief, as some investors were bracing for a larger miss . The report also highlighted a strong performance in its energy storage division .  Tesla’s shares are extremely volatile and have had 132 moves greater than 2.5% over the last year . The previous big move we wrote about was a day ago when the stock dropped 5.5%. Wall Street analysts are growing increasingly pessimistic about the company's Q2 delivery numbers .  Tesla is down 17.4% since the beginning of the year . At $313.39 per share, it is trading 34.7% below its 52-week high of $479.86 from December 2024 . Investors who bought $1,000 worth of Tesla’s shares 5 years ago would now be looking at an investment worth $3,889.86 . S&P 500 Index ($SPX) (SPY) today is up +0.25%, the Dow Jones Industrials Index ($DOWI)(DIA) is down -0.10%, and the Nasdaq 100 Index ($IUXX) (QQQ) is up 0.67% . Strength in semiconductor makers today is leading the broader market higher . Apple and Tesla are climbing more than +2% today to lead megacap technology stocks higher .  The June ADP employment report showed that employment at US companies unexpectedly declined for the first time in more than two years . Weakness in health insurance stocks is also weighing on the overall market . The markets are awaiting a House vote on the Senate version of President Trump’s tax and spending bill .  US MBA mortgage applications rose +2.7% in the week ended June 27, with the purchase mortgage sub-index up +0.1% . The average 30-year fixed rate mortgage fell -9 bp to 6.79% from 6.88% the prior week . US June ADP employment unexpectedly fell -33,000, weaker than expectations of a +98,000 increase . On the negative side for stocks is the upcoming earnings season, which begins next week .  June nonfarm payrolls are expected to climb by +113,000, and the June employment rate is expected to tick up +0.1 to 4.3% . Only six of the 11 S&P 500 sectors are projected to post an increase in earnings, the fewest since Q1 of 2023 .  September 10-year T-notes (ZNU25) today are down by -7 ticks . The 10-yr T-note yield is up +4.7 bp to 4.289% . Speculation that Congress is close to passing President Trump’s tax and spending bill has sparked some weakness . Losses are limited after ADP employment change unexpectedly declined for first time in more than two years .  The 10-year German bund yield jumped to a 1-1/2 month high of 2.675% and is up +8.5 bp to 2.659%. The Eurozone May unemployment rate unexpectedly rose +0.1 to 6.3%, showing a weaker labor market than expectations of no change at 6.2% ECB Governing Council member Centeno said the ECB “is not in a hurry” to cut interest rates further despite inflation being at its 2% target .  Tesla (TSLA) is up more than +4% to lead gainers in the Nasdaq 100 after reporting June Shanghai deliveries rose +0.8% y/y to 71,599 units . Donald Trump’s Big Beautiful Bill Act has passed through the Senate . Vice President JD Vance's tiebreaking vote was the only tiebreak vote . Elon Musk has broken his social media silence to criticise the “insane spending bill” and threatened to launch a competing political party .  Muskarguest says the bill is “utterly insane and destructive” and “will destroy millions of jobs in America and cause immense strategic harm to our country!” He contends that the bill removes subsidies for electric and clean-fuel vehicles, reduces the value of tax credits for new wind and solar projects, and speeds up the phaseout of existing ones .  The bill could cost 300,000 jobs and result in $220 billion in lost clean energy investment in the U.S. by 2030 . One expert says current decisions risk stalling clean energy growth, while other countries push forward with renewables .  The removal of fuel sourcing restrictions and retention of PTCs confirm strong federal support for advanced nuclear technologies, says Julien Dumoulin-Smith, energy analyst at investment bank Jefferies . Whether the bill will damage the country or Trump’s presidency may depend on how aggressively Muskchooses to fight back .  For a president fixated on putting America first, that may prove to be the most consequential outcome . “The president is trying to put America first. efforts,” says Rice University professor .

Sales of Tesla electric cars fell sharply in the last three months as boycotts over Elon Musk's political views continue to keep buyers away . The 13% plunge in global sales over a year earlier suggests the damage to Tesla's brand from Musk's embrace of U.S. President Donald Trump and far-right European politicians is much deeper than some investors had expected .  Sales of the Models 3 and Y totaled 373,728, above the estimate of 356,000 from Wall Street analysts . Musk has promised a cheaper EV model would be coming this year that would boost sales .  Tesla sales fell 28% in May in 30 European countries even as the overall market for electric vehicles expanded sharply, according to the European Automobile Manufacturers’ Association . 30% of Republicans have an unfavorable opinion of Tesla .  Tesla reports second quarter financial results on July 23 . In the first quarter,net income fell 71% . Tesla says much of the sales plunge is due to customers holding off while they wait for an upgrade to the Model Y .

Tesla stock climbs about 5% after it reports global electric vehicle deliveries that came in below Wall Street's low projections . Production of 410,244 vehicles across its global plants in the second quarter, a jump from 400,082 expected . Tesla also deployed 9.6 gigawatt-hours of energy storage products, up from 9.4 GWh last year .  Tesla stock is down more than 25% for the year . CEO Elon Musk's controversial foray into politics has damaged both his own and Tesla's reputation . New data on Tuesday also showed Tesla's sales dropped for the sixth straight month in Sweden and Denmark .  Elon Musk and President Trump's feud reignited on social media, sending Tesla stock down 5% on Tuesday . Trump threatened to cancel subsidies for Musk's businesses, including Tesla and SpaceX, after a series of posts from Musk slamming the president's "big, beautiful" tax and spending bill . Senate passed the bill on Tuesday, signaling it would end electric vehicle tax credits, an incentive for Tesla customers, on Sept. 30 .  Investors had previously seen Trump and Musk's friendship as a boon to Tesla's robotaxi ambitions . Trump'smegabillsince he left his role in D.C. running the newly created federal Department of Government Efficiency .

Tesla saw sales drop in the U.S. year-over-year in the second quarter . Even Hyundai and Kia, which had found early success with their EVs in the States, saw drops . General Motors bucked the trend, growing U .S. EV sales year over-year thanks to a slate of new and improved models .  $25,000 car on the same next-generation platform that powers Tesla’s dedicated robotaxi vehicle, the Cybercab, is still in the prototype phase .

Tesla deliveries fell 13.5% in the second quarter, missing analysts' expectations . The automaker now needs to deliver over one million vehicles in the typically strong second half to avoid another annual sales decline . CEO Elon Musk's right-wing political stances and aging vehicle line-up have turned off some buyers .  Some investors welcomed the numbers, though with caution . Tesla has leaned on offers such as low-cost financing to boost demand . It has yet to roll out long-promised cheaper models in a market where snazzy and feature-packed EVs from its Chinese rivals have been winning over buyers .  In the second quarter to June 30, Tesla handed over 384,122 vehicles, down from 443,956 units a year ago . Still, the number marked an increase of 14% from the January-March period . Analysts expected the company to deliver 394,378 vehicles, according to an average of 23 estimates from Visible Alpha .  Some analysts say Tesla has benefited from its premium, reliable brand image in China . Sales also rose in Norway and Spain last month as some buyers turned to the new Model Y crossover SUV .
Tesla sales fell sharply in the second quarter as Musk backlash and competition chipped away at company's dominance . Tesla sales fall sharply in second quarter .

The war of words between Tesla CEO Elon Musk and U.S. President Donald Trump has reignited . Musk slammed Trump’s new tax bill, calling it a “disgusting abomination” The market didn’t take it lightly .  Tesla’s solar and battery storage units also benefit from federal tax breaks . The bill includes a “special rule” that preserves tax credits through 2026 . Tesla's energy division has warned that ending these incentives would hurt grid reliability .  U.S. tax credits have somewhat supported Tesla’s price cuts and margin defense strategy . Without tax incentives, big bets on solar and battery storage become harder to scale, slowing a business that Tesla sees as its next growth engine .  From a valuation standpoint, TSLA trades at a forward price-to-sales ratio of 9.18, way above the industry’s . Meanwhile, Ford is up 14.6% while General Motors is down just 2.6%. Tesla stock currently carries a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell)  Report This article was originally published by Zacks Investment Research . Roundhill Investments unveiled the Humanoid Robotics ETF (HUMN) on June 26 . It's the first U.S.-listed exchange-traded fund dedicated exclusively to companies shaping the future of humanoid robotics . Humanoid robots, as defined by the fund, are machines designed to mimic human bodies and perform human tasks .  The Roundhill Humanoid Robotics ETF (HUMN) launched on June 26 and trades on the Cboe BZX . It's the first U.S.-listed ETF dedicated specifically to the humanoid robotics industry . The global humanoid robot market is set to reach nearly $114 billion by 2033, growing at a compound annual rate of 40% .  The fund’s managers look for firms pushing the boundaries in artificial intelligence, sensor technology, and mechanical dexterity . The fund holds 30 positions, with top weights allocated to Tesla (12.21%), Nvidia (8.35%), UBTech Robotics (7.49%), Shenzhen Dobot (5.96%), Xiaomi (XIacy) and XPeng (XPEV) The fund has assets under management of $2.75 million, with an expense ratio of 0.75% .  Tesla is committed to investing $10 billion in autonomous technology and aims to produce 5,000 Optimus humanoid robots in 2025 alone . The company is positioning itself at the center of a new ecosystem, providing the brains and tools that enable robots to operate in complex environments .  Sachs now projects the humanoid robot addressable market could reach $38 billion by 2035, with global shipments expected to hit 1.4 million units . Morgan Stanley forecasts the humanoid robotics market could surpass $5 trillion by 2050 .  Tesla and Nvidia are pushing the technology forward, and analysts see a bright long-term future for the industry . This is a young industry with plenty of unknowns, so shares could move in either direction as the market gets a feel for what’s possible . For anyone interested in the space, starting with a small position and keeping an eye on developments is a solid approach .

Alphabet owns Waymo, the undisputed leader in autonomous driving right now . Waymo has the largest autonomous driving footprint in the U.S. Waymo is currently available in five cities: Los Angeles, Phoenix, San Francisco, Atlanta, and Austin .  Washington, D.C., is probably the most intriguing location on this list . It has one key factor in common with the other six cities: It snows . Waymo's footprint gives it a significant lead in the autonomous driving space, but Tesla could catch up .  Alphabet's revenue rose 12% year over year and diluted earnings per share increased 49% in Q1 . Alphabet's stock can be scooped up for a mere 19.9 times trailing earnings . It has seldom traded for a level this cheap, which tells me that Alphabet is being valued on its legacy search business .  Alphabet's core business is still performing admirably and integrating AI technologies into the Google Search product to keep it relevant . Waymo is another exciting division within Alphabet and could emerge as a significant revenue generator for the business over the next decade . There's significant upside in Alphabet's stock, and I think investors shouldconsider buying shares while they're still relatively affordable . Elon Musk’s plan for saving Tesla is blowing up faster than aSpaceX rocket . Investors were clamoring for that old Musk magic to pivot the electric vehicle company into an AI juggernaut . Tesla isexpected to report yet another quarter of declining global sales on Wednesday .  The Tesla CEO recently left his role as a special government adviser to focus on reviving Tesla . This week he picked another fight with President Trump over the president’s deficit-exploding tax and spending bill .  Analysts had forecast that Tesla sales sank 13% in the April-June period compared with a year earlier . That could end up being evenworsethan the first quarter, when Tesla reported its sharpest year-over-yearsales decline ever .  Tesla only managed a $409 million profit last quarter thanks to the sale of $595 million worth of regulatory credits to other automakers . If Trump succeeds in passing his signature spending bill, those credits will evaporate . Tesla relies on credits to stay profitable, but it also needs favorable regulations just to compete with rivals like Waymo .  Tesla shares are down 37% from their post-election peak, when Musk was a fixture at Mar-a-Lago . The thinking on Wall Street back then was that any blowback from the company’s liberal base would be outweighed by the benefit of having Musk in the White House, influencing regulations .

Ford and General Motors reported surging sales in the second quarter . But new data suggests the windfall was fueled largely by panic buyers trying to get ahead of tariffs . The Trump administration slapped a 25% tariff on imported cars and trucks in April, along with duties on foreign-made parts .  GM said its second-quarter sales rose 7% to 746,588 vehicles, sending its shares up 5.7% on Tuesday . Ford shares jumped 4.6% and have climbed over 14% this year . Sales of the company’s F-Series, Ranger, and Maverick pickups climbed 15% to 288,564 .  Sales fell from 17.6 million in April to 17.5 million in June, the slowest in 12 months . Cox Automotiveestimates importing a car will cost $5,700 more under tariffs . Consumers may be looking at 4% to 8% price hikes .  GM sold a total of 46,280 electric vehicles in Q2, representing a 111% year-over-year increase . Ford’s sales of all-electric vehicles, meanwhile, fell 31% YoY in the quarter, though sales of hybrid vehicles rose 23% .

According to most demand projections, electric vehicle (EV) stockshave a bright future . Tesla's capital advantage is undeniable . There's one opportunity in particular that could create significant value . It's not easy to start an electric car manufacturing business .  Tesla has an enviable capital advantage because it can raise new capital at any time . Lucid and Rivian remain unprofitable, but Tesla has been profitable nearly every quarter for the past five years . Tesla can raise $25 billion in fresh cash by diluting existing shareholders by just 2.5% .  Elon Musk recently launched a robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, powered by semi-autonomous Tesla vehicles . Eventually, Tesla intends to produce Cybercabs: EV designed specifically for autonomous taxi services . Cathie Wood, CEO of Ark Invest, thinks 90% of Tesla's market cap will eventually be attributed to its robotxi division .  The robotaxi opportunity alone could add $1 trillion to Tesla's market cap by the end of 2026 . That suggests more than 100% in near-term upside, with plenty of runway in the years to come .  Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late for investors . Nvidia, Apple, Netflix and Netflix are all receiving "Double Down" alerts . There may not be another chance like this anytime soon . Tesla TSLA has been a polarizing stock over the last decade, delivering massive gains for investors . In 2025, shares have been volatile, down 25% overall with big price swings . Tesla reported Q1 revenue of $19.3 billion and adjusted EPS of $0.27 in its latest release .  Tesla delivered roughly 337k EVs and produced nearly 363k throughout the period . Sales climbed 67% year-over-year to $2.7 billion . The company’s gross margin contracted to 16.3% vs. a 17.4% print in the same period last year .  Rivian has 100% US vehicle manufacturing and sources most materials (excluding cells) in the US . The company revised its current-year guidance concerning vehicle deliveries as a result, now expecting FY25 deliveries in a range of 40-60k . The earnings outlook for Rivian remains bullish, with the current Zacks Consensus EPS estimate of -$2.49 up 14% .  Rivian RIVN shares have been much stronger in 2025, with the company’s EPS outlook much more favorable . Tesla's current Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) rating, investors would be better off waiting on positive EPS revisions .

Ether (ETH) price fell to $2,418.39 on July 1 after a day of steady losses . The downturn follows a high-profile dispute between Elon Musk and Donald Trump over the former president’s tax-and-spending plan .  SharpLink Gaming (Nasdaq: SBET) acquired an additional 9,468 ETH — worth $22.8 million — between June 23 and June 27 . This brings its total ETH holdings to 198,167, reinforcing its position as the world’s largest publicly traded holder of ETH .  BitMine has disclosed a $250 million private placement to fund an ETH treasury strategy . The deal, expected to close by July 3, includes major backers such as Pantera, Founders Fund, Galaxy Digital, Kraken, and DCG . ETH declined 3.3% over the past 24 hours, falling from $2,500.88 to $2.418.39 .  ETH briefly dipped to $2,404.47 amid the session’s highest volume of 379,855. steepest decline occurred during the 14:00 UTC hour . Bearish trend structure remains intact, with lower highs and lower lows and no clear volume-based reversal indicators .
